intro: Psychotria lutescens var. lobata, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. It is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
